answers.answer: How far along are you? Could be carpal tunnel which some ladies get during pregnancy. It causes numbness in fingers and hands and stiffness which makes them feel like they are locking. It happens mostly on a night time. Put it into Google and see if you can relate to it. It disappears after birth. X
I'm 17wks. And thank you. I'll check on that

Hi, I'm 27 weeks and have this a few weeks now too, it's worse that I'm a hairdresser which makes use of my hands very hard sometimes  and i must add im expecting twins, my Doctor suggests carpel tunnel syndrome it's so annoying but supposed to disappear after birth
On the same boat for months already. I really hate the feeling :(
I have the same problem Dr ad it's carpel tunnel syndrome I wear a brace at night. Apparently some women get it and some don't.
Thank you ladies so much. Everyone I have asked about in my family has never experienced it so I wasn't sure if I was the only one. I'll be talking to my doctor at my next visit in a few weeks

question: So I remember with my last pregnancy my fingers will fall asleep and start to get numb after a while. I told my doctor but didn't get much help on it. Now with this pregnancy I'm feeling it again.My right hand will start to numb and it hurts really bad. It happens all the time. While I'm sleeping, reading,texting and even some times put of no where. I has DG with my last pregnancy but not sure if I have it with this one yet(extra info just in case that might have to do with it) I'm going to bring it up to my doctor again in my next visit. Anyone felt this? Could it be just my blood flow?
title: Numbness in fingers?
